documents.title: background : budget backed with support from the with greens
text: the scottish government 's tax and spending plans for the next year have passed their final parliamentary hurdle .
the budget includes major changes to scotland 's income tax rates and bands , which will see middle and high earners pay more and lower earners pay less .
the minority snp government struck a deal with the scottish greens last month that gave them enough support to pass the budget .
the final vote was 70 to 56 .
the deal agreed with the greens saw the party 's six msps support the budget in return for a package which includes £ 170m more for local councils than had originally been proposed .

scottish greens co-convener patrick harvie said the concessions his party had won in return for its support meant that `` the £ 157m of local government cuts proposed by the snp '' had been `` more than reversed '' .

however he spoke at length about wanting more reform to local government finance going forward , saying the greens would want to see `` meaningful progress '' on this front - including a `` full replacement '' of the council tax - before they entered into any future budget talks .

documents.title: on the buses : how are they doing ? by david henderson , bbc scotland business correspondent
text: how is scotland 's local bus network performing ?
it 's sometimes hard to tell .
with around 200 bus companies operating on scottish roads , standards vary .
what local campaigners want - and what bus firms deliver - are often miles apart .
why ?
buses were de-regulated by margaret thatcher 's government over 30 years ago .
as a result , almost all routes are served by private firms , which do n't have to run unprofitable services .
they can cherry- the ones they want .
by contrast , scotrail 's performance is measured in minute detail .
the headline figures on performance and punctuality are published every month .
other , broader performance indicators are published every three months , which tell us if the station toilets are clean enough , and whether the public address systems are easy to hear .
the result - scotrail 's under the spotlight - and if it struggles , the operator 's on the rack .
so it 's not ideal .
it 's hard to gauge the performance of 200 bus companies .
but it really matters , since scotland 's buses carry three times as many passengers as scotrail .
and many passengers ca n't afford to drive or take the train .

text: many yellow , amber and even some red 'take action ' weather warnings have been issued as the uk has battled a severe winter .
but how is the warning level actually decided and why are they so important ?
sarah keith-lucas explains the process behind the system .

documents.title: weather warnings need more work
text: george mair from the confederation of passenger transport says there were different understandings around what the weather warnings meant .
mr mair asks if there is a better way to communicate this .
he says people are not getting it .

documents.title: background : what is a weather warning ?
text: the met office has different types of weather warnings to make sure that people stay safe when severe weather - such as heavy rain , snow , wind , fog and ice - hits the uk .
the warnings have different colours depending on how severe - and potentially dangerous - the weather is .
these are yellow , amber and red .
a red weather warning is the most serious kind of weather warning that the met office can issue .
it means that it is likely that the weather will cause damage - for example , to buildings and roads .

the met office says that when it issues a red weather warning , people must stay away from areas which could be potentially dangerous and they should follow the advice of the emergency services and local authorities .
read more here .

documents.title: public understanding of warning system
text: tory msp jamie greene wonders if there is enough understanding of the difference between red and amber warnings among the public .
mr yousaf says feedback from previous weather events indicated people felt there was too much different travel advice .
during the beast from the east , more of a concerted effort was made to deliver one unified message , he explains .
george mair from the confederation of passenger transport agrees there are different understandings of warnings from across the sector .

documents.title: were trunk road closures considered ?
text: lib dem msp mike rumbles asks if the closure of trunk roads was ever considered .
the minister says the weather event was well trailed in the media and yet many people still chose to travel .
he expresses concern that closing the trunk road network would lead to capacity issues on local roads , though confirms this is an option for police scotland to take .
confederation of passenger transport 's george mair explains bus and coach operators would prefer for roads to stay open so they can continue their services , particularly if train lines are shut .

documents.title: background : scotland 's gritters go viral
text: scotland has a set of surprise heroes - in the form of road gritters .
thanks to social media , transport scotland 's fleet of light-flashing , salt-spraying kings of the road have become a bit of a sensation .
followers have been glued to their screens following the roads authority 's gritter tracker .
they were surprised to find out the vehicles had humorous names like sir andy flurry , sir salter scott and gritty gritty bang bang .
the force was with the people of ayrshire during tuesday 's snow flurries , their roads were being protected by luke snowalker
around dunblane , sir andy flurry was out on duty .

along with strong snow-slaying names like the ice destroyer , snow queen and ice buster , more unassuming gritters like fred , jack and frosty have also been out and about keeping the country moving .
not forgetting sprinkles , sparkle and ready spready go .

documents.title: 'we had record salt '
text: transport minister humza yousaf thanks the control room staff right across the emergency services .
mr yousaf says everyone performed well and all the agencies worked really well together in a coordinated fashion .
he says there is always equipment that can be invested in but how much it will be used has to be considered .
the minister concludes by saying there is still plenty of salt in stock for gritting .
`` we had record salt . ''

documents.title: background : scotland 's reaction to the snow
text: in the face of the 'beast from the east ' '' armies '' of parent volunteers were mobilised to try to get schools ready .
the scottish government also opened the bellwin scheme , set up to help councils who face large costs from damage due to the severe weather .
scotrail said `` a massive thank you to everyone at the scotrail alliance that worked tirelessly day and night to get scotland 's railway back up and running . ''

documents.title: praise for bus services
text: george mair from the confederation of passenger transport also praises the work of the bus and coach industry and the speed at which it was able to resume services .
he highlights that these events are not a regular occurrence but feels operators dealt with the situation appropriately .

documents.title: 'i 'm proud of how we performed during the red weather warning '
text: alex hynes from the scotrail alliance says : `` overall i 'm proud of how we performed during the red weather warning . ''
mr hynes says staff went above and beyond the call of duty .
he says the key factor in every decision made was safety .
an initial review of how scotrail performed has been carried out and mr hynes concedes not everything was perfect citing some issues around timetables .

documents.title: background : emergency weather funding scheme for councils activated
text: on 3 march an emergency funding scheme was opened for local authorities in the wake of the severe weather .
the scottish government said it would consider applications for financial assistance through the bellwin scheme , after scottish borders council requested help .
the discretionary fund is designed to help councils which face extra costs as a result of large-scale emergencies .
the move came after major disruption caused by the `` beast from the east '' .

documents.title: 'clear , concise and consistent ' advice delivered throughout weather warnings
text: transport minister humza yousaf says `` clear , concise and consistent '' advice was given out through the amber and red warning period by police scotland and transport scotland .
he praises the collaborative work of various stakeholders , particularly the emergency services who assisted those stranded on the m80 .
the bellwin scheme was triggered due to the severe weather , he confirms .
this means emergency financial assistance was available to local authorities for costs incurred due to the weather .

documents.title: background : drivers stranded amid red alert for snow
text: on 28 februrary a red alert for snow was in force for many of scotland 's most highly-populated areas as blizzard conditions left some motorists stranded for hours on roads in the central belt .
trains , flights and many bus services in the affected areas were stopped .
driving conditions were treacherous , and people were told not to travel unless it was absolutely necessary .
the red warning of major disruption covered strathclyde , lothian , tayside , fife and central , as well as parts of south east scotland and the borders .
